bio: Ph.D. Student at MIT CSAIL w/ Torralba

technical_depth.evidence: Multiple top-tier publications (ICCV 2025 Multimodal Video Gen, ICLR 2024 Visual-Tactile, CVPR 2024 3D Assembly, ICML 2023 Preconditioners, etc.); recent ES/LoRA for reasoning research discussed technically on X with trust-region/spectral norm analysis.

project_evidence.evidence: GitHub repos for papers: MMVidSim (ICCV 2025, 1 star), Preconditioner (ICML 2023), multi-joint-assembly (CVPR 2024), 3DPartAssembly (ECCV 2020); active research code releases, no high-star OSS.

mission_alignment.evidence: Focus on multimodal world models, video generation, RL/ES for reasoning, physics sim; posts on frontier AI topics like ES+LoRA for reasoning at NeurIPS 2025.

exceptional_ability.evidence: First-author papers solving hard problems in multimodal rep learning, scalable post-training (ES), 3D assembly planning; PhD CSAIL Torralba; ownership of projects.

communication.evidence: Clear, technical X threads/posts explaining research (e.g., ES hyperparameters, LoRA updates); structured paper abstracts; WIP blog.

summary: Outstanding PhD researcher from MIT CSAIL with a strong track record of publications in multimodal AI, world models, and optimization techniques highly relevant to AGI pursuits. Demonstrates deep technical expertise and active engagement in frontier topics like ES for reasoning.
strengths: Top-tier publications in relevant AI areas
Active research in world models and reasoning
Technical discussions on X showing depth
